title: Ratio test for infinite series convergence

blocks.name: cvgrat
blocks.content: Ratio test for convergence of a complex infinite series. If the ratio ` A ` of the absolute values of successive terms in an infinite sequence ` F ` is less than 1 for all terms beyond some index ` B ` , then the infinite sum of the terms of ` F ` converges to a complex number. Equivalent to first part of Exercise 4 of [Gleason] p. 182. (Contributed by NM, 26-Apr-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm cvgrat(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cseq(c0, caddc, c1), cdm(cli)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c5, clt, nat1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cc))

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
